2009. The dispute over Mirafiori is also part of a wider struggle by the outspoken Sergio Marchionne to bring about radical reforms in Italian industry. In October, he ignited controversy when he said that Fiat would be better off if it eliminated Italy. Italy ranks 118th out of 139 countries in work efficiency and is 48th in industrial competitiveness. "Not a cent from the two billion euros of profits forecast for 2010 will be generated in Italy, he said, pointing out that Fiat's 6,100 workers in Poland produce the same number of cars as the company's 22,000 auto workers in Italy.
